meanings.definition: The state of being alive or living.
meanings.sent1: The alivenesses of the forest were evident in the chirping of birds and rustling of leaves.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the alivenesses of the city as people bustled around her.
meanings.sent3: The alivenesses of the party made it impossible not to dance.
meanings.sent4: The alivenesses of the ocean seemed to call out to her, inviting her to dive in.
meanings.sent5: The alivenesses of the garden filled her with a sense of peace and joy.

meanings.definition: The quality of being lively or energetic.
meanings.sent1: The children's laughter added a sense of alivenesses to the playground.
meanings.sent2: Her performance on stage was full of alivenesses that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The alivenesses of the puppy was contagious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The alivenesses of the music brought the party to life, filling the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The alivenesses of the painting seemed to jump off the canvas, vibrant and dynamic.
